column4: i have a complete sharing setup right now, the problem i am facing it , when i share any file from any other drive except C:, i received an error, unable to mount, while if file store on C drive it opens

i have a complete sharing setup right now, the problem i am facing it , when i share any file from any other drive except C:, i received an error, unable to mount, while if file store on C drive it opens
i thing that you have a probleme with the rights on your d:
how to assign rights ? as i tried but its automatically came back to previous one :S
on your windows system, right mouse then property. somewhere you should be able tou manage right. Just ensure that everybody can read/write
depending on what you want
yup exactly i did, by default file access has --, when i change it to read and write i comes back to -- again
on next stage is has group option, i guess i need to select samba share, but again its on ubuntu by default, if i change it on sambashare, i came back on ubuntu, any solution
i think i'm missing something.
what
what are you trying to do exactly ? share a windows folder from ubuntu ? or access a windows shared folder from ubuntu ?
i am trying to share a folder from my laptop (ubuntu installed) on my desktop (ubuntu install)
i just want to copy that folder from the D: drive of my laptop, i am able to copy it by moving that folder from D: to C: drive, but directly from D: drive i can't
ok, that's strange. They are auto-mounted partitions ?
i can see that folder on my network but when i tries to open it i got that error, unable to mount (failed to mount windows share)
yes they are auto mounted, it does not ask password on mounting
are you sure to have the same options for both partition in you fstab file ?
on your laptop
i do not now what fstab is, i am new to ubuntu.
know*
oh, so you just clic on the partition then i self mount
yes when i click any partition,its mount automatically.
ok so
can you open a new console then go to your c drive ?
